UPN #313 Will Not Operate Past Rogers Park  (UPDATE)
UPN train #313, scheduled to arrive Winnetka at 8:42 AM, remains stopped near Clybourn. Once on the move they will only operate to Rogers Park. Train #315 will accommodate passengers.

MDW Grand and Cicero North Elevator Out of Service
The Grand Cicero North elevator is out of service. Customers can use Western Avenue or Hanson Park as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

ME Van Buren Street Station Elevator Is Out Of Service

The Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use Millennium Station's South Water elevator or the McCormick Place elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

UPN #324 Will Originate At Rogers Park

UPN train #324 scheduled to depart Highland Park at 9:01 AM, will originate from Rogers Park due to an earlier mechanical problem. Train #326 will accommodate passengers. Listen to announcements for updates and visit metra.com for schedule information.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
UPN Inbound Trains On The Move (UPDATE #2)
UPN inbound trains are on the move and may be operating with extensive delays. Please listen to announcements for delay times and train locations.

ME All trains will ground load at 111th, 107th, 103rd, 95th, 91st, 87th, 83rd, 79th, and 75th Street.

ME All trains will ground load at 111th, 107th, 103rd, 95th, 91st, 87th, 83rd, 79th, and 75th Street. Please wait visible to the engineer, do not operate chains or gates in ground load areas, follow train crew's instructions after the train stops

The Museum Campus West Elevator is out of service. Customers can use Millennium Station's South Water elevator or the McCormick Place elevator as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

UPN #312 Will Board on Platform #2 at Clybourn from the UPNW Boarding Area

Union Pacific North train #312 will board from platform #2 at Clybourn from the Union Pacific Northwest boarding area. Passengers should safely make their way to platform #2 on the Union Pacific Northwest boarding area.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-N?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=1&gtfsrt=1
UPN #315 Stopped

UPN train #315, scheduled to arrive Waukegan at 10:19 AM, is stopped near Clybourn due to mechanical problems. The duration of this delay is unknown. Metra will provide updates as information becomes available.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/HC?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
HC Joliet Elevator Out of Service
The Heritage Corridor Joliet elevator is out of service. Customers should use the pedestrian tunnel to access the boarding platform. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street. All trains will board passengers from the rear cars on this platform. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric 103rd Station Closed - Full Reconstruction

As part of the Metra Electric Community Initiative to transform 13 stations on the district, the 103rd Street/Rosemoor station remains closed for a full reconstruction and is expected to reopen next spring. During this time, customers can use 107th Street and 95th Street/Chicago State University as alternatives. For additional information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station elevator out of service until further notice
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service until further notice.  Customers can use the elevator located at 205 N Michigan, which leads to the South Water entrance to Millennium Station
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-W - River Forest Platform 2 Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, May 8, the east half of Platform 2 (island platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the west half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November.

Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Tracks #2, and #4, out of service at Chicago Union Station.

Tracks #2, and #4, are out of service on the south concourse at Chicago Union Station until further notice due to the Canal St., construction project. BNSF, Southwest Service, and Heritage Corridor passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need help, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.

Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Games at Soldier Field
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for Chicago home games at Soldier Field. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

The Metra Union Pacific North Line will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for Chicago home games at Soldier Field. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

Metra Alert - Metra Electric District and Union Pacific North Line Extra Service For Games at Soldier Field

The Metra Electric District and Union Pacific North Line will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for Chicago home games at Soldier Field. For more information click here and visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert - Slippery Rail Season

There's various reasons train service could be affected causing delays. During autumn months when leaves fall on tracks and a train's wheel crush them, a slick oily residue is left behind on the rail. This residue makes it harder for the train to get proper traction to start, stop, and maintain speed. As a result, delays may be experienced during your travel. Plan ahead and allow for extra travel time this autumn season. For additional information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - MDN Mayfair Station Staircase Remodel

The staircase remodel at the Mayfair Station will begin on December 2 through December 20.  During this time, customers should use the staircase located at Montrose Avenue to enter and exit Platforms 1 and 2.  Please allow additional travel time during this construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Work to impact Metra Electric, South Shore service on two December weekends

The Metra Electric Line will be partially shut down on two weekends in December, Dec. 7-8 and Dec. 14-15, due to extensive construction associated with the South Shore Line’s expansion plans, work that will also benefit Metra Electric riders. Train service will terminate and originate from the 18th Street Station, with buses replacing trains between Millennium and 18th, and the line will use a Sunday schedule both Saturday and Sunday on those weekend days.  For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th street/Chatham Station Closure - Reopens December 16, 2024

The 79th street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric will reopen to the public on Monday, December 16, 2024. Until the station is open, passengers should continue using 75th and 83rd street stations as alternatives. When the 79th street/Chatham station is open it may not always be ADA accessible. This will be due to construction work at nearby stations that require periodic track shifts and temporary boarding procedures midday Monday-Friday 9AM to 4PM. Passengers are advised to check service alerts on metra.com to verify the station is accessible prior to travel.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.
